suggestedNewContent.title: Common Installation Mistakes to Avoid
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: 1. Don't install in paths with spaces (C:\Program Files\flutter - BAD). 2. Don't install in paths requiring admin privileges. 3. For Windows, use GUI to set PATH - PowerShell setx can overwrite your entire PATH. 4. On Mac, remember to restart terminal after PATH changes. 5. Don't panic about red X marks in flutter doctor - many are optional for now.

suggestedNewContent.title: Understanding Flutter Doctor Output
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain what each section of flutter doctor means: Flutter/Dart (required), Android toolchain (needed for Android development), Chrome (needed for web), Xcode (Mac only, needed for iOS), and VS Code/Android Studio (your editor). Clarify that beginners only need Flutter/Dart checkmarks to proceed to the next lesson.

suggestedNewContent.title: Expected Terminal Output
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show actual terminal session with: 1. flutter --version output showing 3.38.x. 2. flutter doctor output with explanatory annotations. 3. Common warnings and what they mean.

suggestedNewContent.title: Checking Your Mac Type (Intel vs Apple Silicon)
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Instructions for checking: Click Apple menu > About This Mac. If it says 'Chip: Apple M1/M2/M3/M4' you have Apple Silicon. If it says 'Processor: Intel' you have Intel. Also mention Rosetta requirement for Apple Silicon.

suggestedNewContent.title: Troubleshooting Common Issues
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Address: 1. 'flutter is not recognized' - PATH not set correctly. 2. cmdline-tools missing - how to install via Android Studio SDK Manager. 3. Android licenses not accepted - run 'flutter doctor --android-licenses'. 4. Java version issues - need Java 11+.
